title.narrative: 005 CAPACITY FOR SUPPLY AND LOGISTICS

description.narrative: Guidance and technical support for supplies in programme results, which contributes to Supply And Logistics, Unicef Capacity For Supply And Logistics. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Management and support to the country programme are effective and efficient

mailing-address.narrative: UNICEF House (Kazanchis - Opposite UNECA/German House) P.O. Box 1169 Addis Ababa

sector.narrative: CO/RO Supply - technical assistance and collaboration in supply chain, procurement of goods and services, and logistics
Country programme process (including UNDAF planning and CCA)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Guidance and technical support for supplies in programme results

description.narrative: Effective procurement strategy and coordinated logistics arrangement was implemented to respond to the drought and health emergencies | Status:On-track | As-of Date:30/06/2016

title.narrative: Value and % of excess supplies in the warehouses from approved Min/Max/preposition levels

baseline.value: 10 million USD in September, 2012, December 2013 4 million USD

target.value: 2016:< 10 % (app 1.1 million USD) of the value of approved stock - Min Max/Preposition

actual.value: 2016:Progress on excess has been reported to CMT on monthly basis. Even though, it is showing a declining trend from US$10 million in September 2012 to US$ 5.7 million (approx.) as of 30th June 2016, but it is still higher than the target. This is due to the huge procurement of supplies for the current e

title.narrative: % and value of expired supplies/ annum/ average value of supplies in stock

baseline.value: 3.2 % of the average supply stock value

target.value: 2016:Value of Expiry not more <1% of the average value of supplies

actual.value: 2016:The value of damaged supplies during this period was less than 0.05% of the value of the supplies in the warehouses.

title.narrative: Master procurement schedule prepared annually and monitored quarterly

baseline.value: Master procurement prepared in October 2013, updated monthly

actual.value: 2016:The Master Procurement Schedule was updated every month up to 30.06.2016. The annual report for the Ethiopian fiscal year end 2008, was also prepared and shared with PMU. The new MPS for 2009 is under preparation.
